channel.title: Cant go from 64-bit java to 32-bit java
channel.description:
Ok, so I have Kubuntu Jaunty with KDE4, 64-bit. Everything works, except that I can't get any client to run correctly. Whether it be Jagex's, SwiftKit, RsBot, or anything. Whenever I try to do anything, or click on the applet, or any applet for that matter, more than twice, The JVM prints out something similar to this message:
java version "1.6.0_14" Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment (build 1.6.0_14-b08) Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 14.0-b16, mixed mode) zyle@zephyrion:~/Desktop/Oraculum Client$ java client lowmem RS2 user client - release #317 # # A fatal error has been detected by the Java Runtime Environment: # # SIGSEGV (0xb) at pc=0xf734131d, pid=6529, tid=2990009232 # # JRE version: 6.0_14-b08 # Java VM: Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (14.0-b16 mixed mode linux-x86 ) # Problematic frame: # V [libjvm.so+0x11931d] # # An error report file with more information is saved as: # /home/zyle/Desktop/Oraculum Client/hs_err_pid6529.log # # If you would like to submit a bug report, please visit: # http://java.sun.com/webapps/bugreport/crash.jsp # Aborted
MITB told me that 64-bit JVM's are buggy, so that's why i'm trying to switch to the 32-bit version, but even that doesn't work. The JVM works when it's something other than an applet(signed or unsigned). Does anyone have any ideas on how to fix this?

item.title: Cant go from 64-bit java to 32-bit java
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Ah. miscommunication on my part. Thanks, I’ll do that ^_^[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 09, 2009, 06:44:28 pm[/size][hr]Ok, so I switched to the default java package, 64-bit, openJDK 32 and 64 bit, amd the ia32 libs. None of them work.

Read full topic
item.source: Cant go from 64-bit java to 32-bit java

item.title: Cant go from 64-bit java to 32-bit java
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I told you they weren’t buggy at all and I haven’t had a single problem from them in the many years I have been using them.

That being said, if you want to ‘switch’ you will also need a 32-bit browser to use applets.

Read full topic
item.source: Cant go from 64-bit java to 32-bit java

item.title: Cant go from 64-bit java to 32-bit java
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Install 32bit libraries and then JRE/JDK.

Read full topic
